撒.definition: to scatter; to sprinkle; to spill

撒丫子.definition: (dialect) to scamper off; to take to one's heels; to make oneself scarce

撒但.definition: variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan

撒切爾.definition: Thatcher (name); Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990

撒切爾夫人.definition: Mrs Thatcher; Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990

撒哈拉以南非洲.pinyin: Sa1 ha1 la1 yi3 nan2 Fei1 zhou1

撒囈掙.definition: (coll.) to talk in one's sleep; to sleepwalk

撒嬌.definition: to act like a spoiled child; to throw a tantrum; to act coquettishly

撒尿.definition: to pass water; to piss; to urinate; to wee wee

撒手.definition: to let go of sth; to give up

撒手不管.definition: to stand aside and do nothing (idiom); to take no part in

撒手人寰.definition: to leave one's mortal frame (idiom); to die

撒手閉眼.definition: to have nothing further to do with a matter (idiom)

撒拉.definition: Salar ethnic group of Qinghai province

撒拉族.definition: Salar ethnic group of Qinghai province

撒拉語.definition: Salar, language of Salar ethnic group of Qinghai province

撒播.definition: to sow (seeds by scattering); scatter sowing

撒氣.definition: to leak (of air); to go flat (of a tire); to vent one's anger

撒督.definition: Zadok (son of Azor and father of Achim in Matthew 1:13)

撒科打諢.definition: to intersperse comic dialogue (as they do in operas)

撒網捕風.definition: lit. the wind cannot be caught in a net; to waste one's effort (idiom)

撒羅滿.definition: (Catholicism) Solomon, a king of ancient Israel

撒腳.definition: to run off; to beat it

撒腿.definition: to take to one's heels; to scram

撒賴.definition: to make a scene; to raise hell

撒酒瘋.definition: to get drunk and act crazy; roaring drunk

撒野.definition: to display shockingly bad behavior; to behave atrociously
